conjectures.label: Conjecture 2.1
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 2.1. For all integers $r \geq 2$, all $S \subseteq[r]$, and all $r$-colorings of a complete graph $K$, there exists a monochromatic $(r-1)$-cover consisting entirely of subgraphs having a color in $S$ or consisting entirely of subgraphs having a color in $[r] \backslash S$.

parameters.name: r-coloring
parameters.definition: An $r$-coloring of the edges of a graph $G$ is a function $c:E(G) \to [r]$; equivalently, a partition of $E(G)$ into (possibly empty) sets $\{E_{1},\ldots,E_{r}\}$.

parameters.name: monochromatic cover
parameters.definition: In an $r$-colored graph $H$, a monochromatic cover is a set $\mathcal{T}$ of monochromatic connected subgraphs with $V(H)=\cup_{T \in \mathcal{T}} V(T)$.

parameters.name: monochromatic $t$-cover
parameters.definition: A monochromatic cover of order at most $t$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 2.2
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 2.2. For all integers $r \geq 2$ and all $K \in \mathcal{K}_{r}, \operatorname{tc}_{r-1}(K) \leq r-1$. In particular, this implies that for every $r$-coloring of a complete graph $K$ and every color $i \in[r]$, either there is a monochromatic $(r-1)$-cover consisting entirely of subgraphs of color $i$, or entirely of subgraphs which don't have color $i$.

parameters.name: \mathcal{K}_{k}
parameters.definition: For $k \geq 2$, $\mathcal{K}_{k}$ is the family of all complete $k$-partite graphs.

parameters.name: \operatorname{tc}_{r}(H)
parameters.definition: The minimum integer $t$ such that in every $r$-coloring of the edges of $H$, there exists a monochromatic $t$-cover of $H$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 2.3
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 2.3. For all integers $r \geq 3$ and all $K \in \mathcal{K}_{r-1}, \operatorname{tc}_{r-1}(K) \leq r-1$. In particular, this implies that for every $r$-coloring of a complete graph $K$ and every color $i \in[r]$, either there is a monochromatic $(r-2)$-cover consisting entirely of subgraphs of color $i$, or a monochromatic $(r-1)$-cover consisting entirely of subgraphs which don't have color $i$.

parameters.name: \mathcal{K}_{k}
parameters.definition: For $k \geq 2$, $\mathcal{K}_{k}$ is the family of all complete $k$-partite graphs.

parameters.name: \operatorname{tc}_{r}(H)
parameters.definition: The minimum integer $t$ such that in every $r$-coloring of the edges of $H$, there exists a monochromatic $t$-cover of $H$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 2.4
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 2.4. For all integers $r \geq 2$, in every $r$-coloring of a complete graph $K$ there exists a monochromatic $(r-1)$-cover such that the monochromatic subgraphs have at most $\lceil r / 2\rceil$ different colors.

parameters.name: r-coloring
parameters.definition: An $r$-coloring of the edges of a graph $G$ is a function $c:E(G) \to [r]$; equivalently, a partition of $E(G)$ into (possibly empty) sets $\{E_{1},\ldots,E_{r}\}$.

parameters.name: monochromatic $t$-cover
parameters.definition: A monochromatic cover of order at most $t$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 2.8
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 2.8. For all $\alpha \geq 1$, there exists $d=d(\alpha)$ such that for all $r \geq 2$, if $G$ is a graph with $\alpha(G)=\alpha$, then in every $r$-coloring of $G$, there exists a monochromatic $(r-1) \alpha$-cover consisting of subgraphs of diameter at most $d$.

parameters.name: $d$
parameters.definition: $d=d(\alpha)$ is a diameter bound depending on $\alpha$.

parameters.name: \alpha(G)
parameters.definition: The size of a maximum independent set of vertices in $G$.

parameters.name: diameter
parameters.definition: For vertices $u,v \in V(G)$, $d(u,v)$ is the length of the shortest $u,v$-path (or $\infty$ if none exists); $\operatorname{diam}(G)$ is the smallest $d$ with $d(u,v) \le d$ for all $u,v \in V(G)$.

parameters.name: monochromatic $t$-cover
parameters.definition: A monochromatic cover of order at most $t$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 2.14
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 2.14. There exists $d$ such that for all $r \geq 2$, if $K \in \mathcal{K}_{2}$, then in every $r$-coloring of $K$, there exists a monochromatic $(2 r-2)$-cover consisting of subgraphs of diameter at most d.

parameters.name: \mathcal{K}_{k}
parameters.definition: For $k \geq 2$, $\mathcal{K}_{k}$ is the family of all complete $k$-partite graphs.

parameters.name: r-coloring
parameters.definition: An $r$-coloring of the edges of a graph $G$ is a function $c:E(G) \to [r]$; equivalently, a partition of $E(G)$ into (possibly empty) sets $\{E_{1},\ldots,E_{r}\}$.

parameters.name: monochromatic $t$-cover
parameters.definition: A monochromatic cover of order at most $t$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 2.19
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 2.19. For all $r \geq 3$, in every $r$-coloring of $K_{n}^{r}$, there exists a monochromatic tightly connected subgraph which covers $V(K)$.

parameters.name: tightly connected
parameters.definition: In a $k$-uniform hypergraph $H$, $H$ is tightly connected if for every pair $u,v \in V(H)$ there exist edges $e_{1},\ldots,e_{p} \in E(H)$ with $u \in e_{1}$, $v \in e_{p}$ and $|e_{i} \cap e_{i+1}|=k-1$ for all $i$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 4.3
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 4.3. For all $\alpha \geq 1$, there exists $\delta=\delta(\alpha)$ such that for all $r \geq 2$, if $G$ is a graph with $\alpha(G)=\alpha$, then $\mathrm{dc}_{r}^{\delta}(G) \leq(r-1) \alpha$.

parameters.name: $\alpha$
parameters.definition: $\alpha \geq 1$ is an integer parameter; $\alpha(G)$ is the independence number of $G$.

parameters.name: $\delta$
parameters.definition: A diameter bound depending on $\alpha$, denoted $\delta=\delta(\alpha)$.

parameters.name: \mathrm{dc}_{r}^{\delta}(G)
parameters.definition: The smallest integer $t$ such that in every $r$-coloring of the edges of $G$, there exists a monochromatic $t$-cover consisting of subgraphs of diameter at most $\delta$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 4.17
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 4.17. Let $G$ be a 3-colored complete graph. There exists a monochromatic 2-cover consisting of subgraphs of diameter at most 3.

parameters.name: $G$
parameters.definition: A complete graph whose edges are colored with 3 colors.

parameters.name: monochromatic 2-cover
parameters.definition: A monochromatic cover of order at most $2$.

parameters.name: diameter bound
parameters.definition: Each subgraph in the cover has $\operatorname{diam} \le 3$.

conjectures.label: Conjecture 4.22
conjectures.conjecture: Conjecture 4.22. Suppose $G$ is a complete 4-partite graph with vertex set partitioned as $\left\{V_{1}, V_{2}, V_{3}, V_{4}\right\}$. If $\left[V_{i}, V_{j}\right]$ is colored with colors from $[5] \backslash\{i, j\}$ for all distinct $i, j \in[4]$, then $G$ can be covered with at most three monochromatic subgraphs of bounded diameter.

parameters.name: [$V_{i},V_{j}$]
parameters.definition: The complete bipartite subgraph induced by the parts $V_{i}$ and $V_{j}$.

parameters.name: $[5] \backslash \{i,j\}$
parameters.definition: The set of colors used on $[V_{i},V_{j}]$ excludes the indices $i$ and $j$.

parameters.name: bounded diameter
parameters.definition: There exists an absolute constant $d$ such that each subgraph in the cover has $\operatorname{diam} \le d$.
